byline.original: By LANDON THOMAS Jr. and JACK EWING

abstract: New European Central Bank president Mario Draghi is seen as pragmatist, but observers say question is whether he can satisfy his competing constituencies as he confronts euro zone crisis; they worry how he might be perceived if Italy experiences its own financial crisis.
snippet: Mario Draghi will take the reins of the European Central Bank on Tuesday, moving into the crosswinds of the region’s financial storm.
lead_paragraph: Mario Draghi will take the reins of the European Central Bank on Tuesday, moving into the crosswinds of the region’s financial storm.

headline.main: Can Super Mario Save the Day for Europe?
headline.print_headline: Can Super Mario Save the Day for Europe?
headline.seo: Mario Draghi, Into the Eye of Europe’s Financial Storm
